226 Peachtree Street, S.W. 
Atlanta, Georgia 30303 
 
 
RE: Complaint of 
, ACRB File #13-37 
 
Dear Chief Turner: 
 
Please be advised that the Atlanta Citizen Review Board (ACRB) has 
concluded its investigation and adjudication of the complaint filed by Mr. 
 
alleging that on May 10, 2013, Atlanta Police Officers Clifton Johnson (Unique ID #0748) 
and Richard Youngblood (Unique ID #5763) engaged in excessive force when they 
grabbed and pepper sprayed him during an incident at his residence. 
 
The Board determined that the excessive force allegation against both officers be 
assigned a finding of Exonerated.  
 
The file is available for review upon request.  The ordinance requires that the 
Chief respond in writing regarding which recommendations are accepted, rejected, or will 
be implemented with modifications within thirty (30) days of the submission of a 
recommendation for action by the Board to the Chief (see Sec. 2-2211(O) of the 
Ordinance 07-0-0141). 
 
Sincerely, 
 
 
William Harrison 
Board Chair 
 
cc:  Mayor Kasim Reed 
 
Council President Ceasar Mitchell

226 Peachtree Street, S.W. 
Atlanta, Georgia 30303 
 
RE: Complaint of 
 & 
,   
ACRB File #13-70 
 
Dear Chief Turner: 
 
Please be advised that the Atlanta Citizen Review Board (ACRB) has concluded its 
investigation and adjudication of the complaint filed by Mr. 
 & 
 
alleging that on May 31, 2013, Atlanta Police Officers David Bourne (Unique ID #5041) and Neil 
Welch (Unique ID #3348) committed the following acts of misconduct: (1) engaged in excessive 
force when they shot 
 
multiple times; (2) caused Mr. 
 death when they 
shot him, and (3) was verbally abusive towards Mr.
 when they yelled words to the effect, 
“Drop the motherfucking gun!” to him. 
 
The Board determined the following: 
 
 
The Excessive Force & Death allegations against both officers be assigned a 
finding of Exonerated  
 
The Abusive Language allegation be assigned a finding of Sustained against 
Officer Bourne and recommend that he received a written reprimand.  
 
The Abusive Language allegation be assigned a finding of Not Sustained 
against Sergeant Welch.  
 
The file is available for review upon request.  The ordinance requires that the Chief 
respond in writing regarding which recommendations are accepted, rejected, or will be 
implemented with modifications within thirty (30) days of the submission of a recommendation for 
action by the Board to the Chief (see Sec. 2-2211(O) of the Ordinance 07-0-0141). 
 
Sincerely, 
 
 
William Harrison 
Board Chair 
 
cc:  Mayor Kasim Reed 
 
Council President Ceasar Mitchell  
 
Members of the Atlanta City Council 
 
ACRB Members 
Executive Director Lee Reid

concluded its investigation and adjudication of the complaint filed by Mr.

 alleging that on January 23, 2015, Atlanta Correction Officer Marquis Calhoun 
Employee ID #36468) engaged in abusive language.

Calhoun be assigned a finding of Not Sustained.

RE: Complaint of 
 ACRB File #15-074 
     
 
Dear Chief Turner: 
 
Please be advised that the Atlanta Citizen Review Board (ACRB) has 
concluded its investigation and adjudication of the complaint filed by Mr. 
 
alleging that on May 28, 2015, Atlanta Police Officers Carla McAdoo (Unique ID #1284), 
Marty Nunn (Unique ID #5057) and Lieutenant Robert Boyd (Unique ID #1701) harassed 
him while at the Atlanta Hartsfield-Jackson International Airport.  Mr. Cooley further 
alleged that Officer McAdoo unlawfully detained him.   
 
The Board determined that the allegations against all of the aforementioned 
officers be assigned a finding of Unfounded. 
 
The file is available for review upon request.  The ordinance requires that the 
Chief respond in writing regarding which recommendations are accepted, rejected, or will 
be implemented with modifications within thirty (30) days of the submission of a 
recommendation for action by the Board to the Chief (see Sec. 2-2211(O) of the 
Ordinance 07-0-0141). 
 
Sincerely, 
 
 
William Harrison 
Board Chair

RE: Complaint of 
, ACRB File #12-56 
     
 
Dear Chief Turner: 
 
Please be advised that the Atlanta Citizen Review Board (ACRB) has 
concluded its investigation and adjudication of the complaint filed by Mr. 
 
alleging that on October 20, 2012, Atlanta Police Officer Andrew Taddei (Unique ID 
#3422) falsely arrested him.  Mr. 
 further alleged that during the incident, Officer 
Taddei engaged in unnecessary excessive force when he:  (1) pepper sprayed him while he 
was in handcuffed and (2) grabbed him by the arm and clothing in an attempt to take him 
to the ground. 
 
The Board determined that both allegations against the officer be assigned a 
finding of Not Sustained. 
 
The file is available for review upon request.  The ordinance requires that the 
Chief respond in writing regarding which recommendations are accepted, rejected, or will 
be implemented with modifications within thirty (30) days of the submission of a 
recommendation for action by the Board to the Chief (see Sec. 2-2211(O) of the 
Ordinance 07-0-0141). 
 
Sincerely, 
 
William Harrison 
Board Chair

October 20, 2015

City of Atlanta Police Department 
226 Peachtree Street, S.W. 
Atlanta, Georgia 30303 
 
 
RE: Complaint of 
, ACRB File #13-
111 
     
 
Dear Chief Turner: 
 
Please be advised that the Atlanta Citizen Review Board (ACRB) has 
concluded its investigation and adjudication of the complaint filed by Ms. 
 
alleging that on October 18, 2013, Atlanta Police Officer Phyllis White (Unique ID 
#5340) engaged in excessive force and abusive language.   
 
The Board determined that the excessive force allegation against Officer White be 
assigned a finding of Not Sustained; however, the Board determined that the abusive 
language force allegation be assigned a finding of Sustained and recommends that Officer 
White receives a written reprimand as penalty. 
 
The file is available for review upon request.  The ordinance requires that the 
Chief respond in writing regarding which recommendations are accepted, rejected, or will 
be implemented with modifications within thirty (30) days of the submission of a 
recommendation for action by the Board to the Chief (see Sec. 2-2211(O) of the 
Ordinance 07-0-0141). 
 
Sincerely, 
 
Board Chair 
 
Attachment

RE: Complaint of 
, ACRB

Dear Chief Turner: 
 
Please be advised that the Atlanta Citizen Review Board (ACRB) has 
concluded its investigation and adjudication of the complaint filed by Mr.
 
 alleging that on April 18, 2015, Atlanta Police Officer Jean Saint Jean 
(Unique ID #4752) used abusive language towards him in that he stated words to the 
effect, “I’m gonna lock your ass up.” 
 
The Board determined that the excessive force allegation against the officer be 
assigned a finding of Not Sustained.  
  
The file is available for review upon request.  The ordinance requires that the 
Chief respond in writing regarding which recommendations are accepted, rejected, or will 
be implemented with modifications within thirty (30) days of the submission of a 
recommendation for action by the Board to the Chief (see Sec. 2-2211(O) of the 
Ordinance 07-0-0141). 
 
Sincerely, 
 
 
William Harrison 
Board Chair

Chief George Turner 
City of Atlanta Police Department 
226 Peachtree Street, S.W. 
Atlanta, Georgia 30303 
 
 
RE: Complaint of
, ACRB File #15-055 
     
Dear Chief Turner: 
 
Please be advised that the Atlanta Citizen Review Board (ACRB) has 
concluded its investigation and adjudication of the complaint filed by Mr. 
 
alleging that on April 5, 2015, Atlanta Police Officer Davon Green (Unique ID #6124) 
and Drew Marshall (Unique ID #6298) falsely imprisonment him when they illegally 
stopped and detained him based on information provided by Officer Casey Freeman, who 
was off-duty at the time of the incident.   
 
The Board determined that the false imprisonment allegation against both officers 
be assigned a finding of Sustained and recommends the following penalty be imposed: 
 
• 
Officer Davon Green receives and oral admonishment 
• 
The Board acknowledges that Officer Drew Marshall is no longer 
employed by APD; however, if Officer Marshall was still on the police 
force, the Board would also have recommended that he receives and oral 
admonishment. 
 
It is also recommended that APD look further into this matter; specifically, APD 
must determine if Officer Casey Freeman violated any APD policies pertaining to his 
actions as it relates to him following Mr. 
 and providing the officers with the 
information that led them to stop Mr. 
. 
 
The file is available for review upon request.  The ordinance requires that the 
Chief respond in writing regarding which recommendations are accepted, rejected, or will 
be implemented with modifications within thirty (30) days of the submission of a 
recommendation for action by the Board to the Chief (see Sec. 2-2211(O) of the 
Ordinance 07-0-0141). 
 
Sincerely, 
 
 
William Harrison 
Board Chair 
cc:  Mayor Kasim Reed 
 
Council President Ceasar Mitchell

Executive Director Lee Reid

Dear Ms, Williams:

[am in receipt of the Atlanta Citizen Review Board's letter pertaining to the complaint
of Mr. MINIM recommending. that the allegation of false imprisonment be

‘The Atlanta Police Department forwarded a response letter indicating the Office of
Professional Standards (OPS) had not concluded its investigation into the allegation
surrounding an incident regarding Mr. ML and had to reject your recommendation.

sustain Officer Green for the Atlanta Police Department work rule 4.1.1. Appropriate

prior to this investigation,

findings regarding this matter, I reject the findings of the Atlanta Citizens Review Board.

Dear Chief Turner: 
 
Please be advised that the Atlanta Citizen Review Board (ACRB) has 
concluded its investigation and adjudication of the complaint filed by Mr. 
 
 alleging that on May 17, 2014, Atlanta Police Officer Kevin Romer (Unique ID 
#5719) and Atlanta Police Sergeant Thomas Apple (Unique #3757 used excessive force 
when they pulled and twisted his injured right arm and wrist which resulted in the re-
fracturing of his wrist while placing him in handcuffs.   
 
The Board determined that the excessive force allegation against the officers be 
assigned a finding of Not Sustained.  
  
The file is available for review upon request.  The ordinance requires that the 
Chief respond in writing regarding which recommendations are accepted, rejected, or will 
be implemented with modifications within thirty (30) days of the submission of a 
recommendation for action by the Board to the Chief (see Sec. 2-2211(O) of the

226 Peachtree Street, S.W. 
Atlanta, Georgia 30303 
 
 
RE: Complaint of 
, ACRB File #15-029 
     
 
Dear Chief Turner: 
 
Please be advised that the Atlanta Citizen Review Board (ACRB) has 
concluded its investigation and adjudication of the complaint filed by Mr. 
 
alleging that on February 11, 2015, Atlanta Police Officer Brian Johnston (Unique ID 
#5757) falsely imprisoned him when he unlawfully stopped and detained him.  
 
The Board determined that the false imprisonment allegation against the officer be 
assigned a finding of Exonerated. 
 
The file is available for review upon request.  The ordinance requires that the 
Chief respond in writing regarding which recommendations are accepted, rejected, or will 
be implemented with modifications within thirty (30) days of the submission of a 
recommendation for action by the Board to the Chief (see Sec. 2-2211(O) of the 
Ordinance 07-0-0141). 
 
Sincerely, 
 
 
William Harrison 
Board Chair

August 19, 2015 
 
 
 
Chief George Turner 
City of Atlanta Police Department 
226 Peachtree Street, S.W. 
Atlanta, Georgia 30303 
 
 
RE: Complaint of 
, ACRB File #15-018 
     
 
Dear Chief Turner: 
 
Please be advised that the Atlanta Citizen Review Board (ACRB) has 
concluded its investigation and adjudication of the complaint filed by Mr. 
 
alleging that on November 25, 2014, Atlanta Police Sergeant Michelle McKenzie 
(Unique ID #3684) falsely arrested him. Mr. 
 further alleged that an unknown 
officer engaged in excessive force when he/she applied the handcuffs extremely tight.  
 
The Board determined that the false arrest allegation against Sergeant 
McKenzie  
be assigned a finding of Sustained and recommends the following penalties be 
imposed: 
• 
Oral admonishment 
• 
Counseling on Professional Conduct  
  
The Board determined that the excessive force allegation be assigned a finding 
of Not Sustained.   
 
The file is available for review upon request.  The ordinance requires that the 
Chief respond in writing regarding which recommendations are accepted, rejected, or 
will be implemented with modifications within thirty (30) days of the submission of a 
recommendation for action by the Board to the Chief (see Sec. 2-2211(O) of the 
Ordinance 07-0-0141).  
 
Sincerely,  
 
William Harrison 
Board Chair

RE: 15-18 Complaint of
Dear Mr. Harrison:

1 am in receipt of the Atlanta Citizens Review Board's leter dated August 19, 2015,
‘which recommends that Sergeant Michelle McKenzie receive a sustained disposition for
falsely arresting Mr. INNNNNNNL and the recommendation be not sustained where
Sergeant McKenzie and an unknown officer were accused of using excessive force by
applying his handeuffs too tight.

‘The Atlanta Police Department's Office of Professional Standards (OPS) has concluded
its investigation into this incident. As a result, Sergeant McKenzie was exonerated of
the allegation of Atlanta Police Department Work Rule 4.1.1 Appropriate Action. In
review of the file, there appeared to be no evidence provided to suggest that unnecessary
force was used during the arest of Mr

Having assessed the Atlanta Citizens Review Board and the Department's investigative
findings regarding this matter, I reject the finding ofthe Atlanta Citizens Review Board.

‘Major B.K. Martin, Commander of the Office of Professional Standards, can be
contacted at (404) 546-5945, if you have any concems regarding this complaint.

Sincerely,

Chief of Police
GNTiiw

Atlanta, Georgia 30303 
 
 
RE: Complaint of 
, ACRB File #14-
062 
     
Dear Chief Turner: 
 
Please be advised that the Atlanta Citizen Review Board (ACRB) has 
concluded its investigation and adjudication of the complaint filed by Mr. 
 
alleging that on February 10, 2014, Atlanta Police Officer Jeffrey Crenshaw (Unique ID 
#0691) engaged in excessive force when he slapped and punched him without 
provocation.   
 
The Board determined that the excessive force allegation against the officer be 
assigned a finding of Not Sustained.  
  
During the course of the investigation, it was revealed that the assisting 
officer, Torrance Profit spent a significant amount of time with Mr. Henderson 
during this incident; however, there is no report documenting that transpired during 
that time spent with him. The Board is recommending that there be a requirement 
that assisting officers provide documented statements in the form of a supplemental 
report detailing what the officer observed, heard and actions taken by the officer 
during an incident.  
 
The file is available for review upon request.  The ordinance requires that the 
Chief respond in writing regarding which recommendations are accepted, rejected, or will 
be implemented with modifications within thirty (30) days of the submission of a 
recommendation for action by the Board to the Chief (see Sec. 2-2211(O) of the 
Ordinance 07-0-0141). 
 
Sincerely, 
 
 
William Harrison 
Board Chair

RE 1 _

Dear Mr. Harrison:

am in receipt of the Atlanta Citizen Review Board's letter pertaining to the complaint
of MNNNINNININN which recommends that the allegation of unnecessary force be not
sustained against Officer Jeffery Crenshaw.

‘The Atlanta Police Department forwarded a response letter indicating the Office of
Professional Standards (OPS) had not concluded its investigation into the allegation
surrounding an incident involving Mr. MINNIE: therefore, rejecting your
recommendation at the time. The investigation has since concluded and it was
determined from evidence to not sustain the allegation of 4.2.50 Unnecessary Force
against Officer Crenshaw.

Having assessed the Atlanta Citizens Review Board and the Department's investigative
findings regarding this matter, I accept the findings of the Atlanta Citizens Review
Board,

Major B.K. Martin, Commander of the Office of Professional Standards, can be
contacted at 404) $46-5945, if you have any concems regarding this complaint.

Sincerely,

/_

George. Tumer
Chief of Police
GNTiw

RE:  Complaint of 
, ACRB  
 File #14-107 
 
Dear Chief Turner: 
 
Please be advised that the Atlanta Citizen Review Board (ACRB) has concluded its 
investigation and adjudication of the complaint filed by Mr. 
 alleging that 
on June 12, 2014, Atlanta Police Officer Consquella Slaton (Unique ID #4151) falsely 
arrested him.  Mr.
 further alleged that Officers Ryan Dobler (Unique ID #4151), 
Timothy Cone (Unique ID #5799) & Michael Monhein (Unique ID #4198) used excessive 
force when they threw him up against a wall.  
 
The Board determined the following: 
• 
False Arrest allegation against Officer Slaton is assigned a finding of 
Exonerated.   
• 
Excessive Force allegation against Officers Dobler, Cone & Monhein is 
assigned a finding of Not Sustained.   
 
The file is available for review upon request.  The ordinance requires that the Chief 
respond in writing regarding which recommendations are accepted, rejected, or will be 
implemented with modifications within thirty (30) days of the submission of a 
recommendation for action by the Board to the Chief (see Sec. 2-2211(O) of the Ordinance 
07-0-0141). 
 
Sincerely, 
 
William Harrison 
Board Chair

Dear Mr. Harrison:

1 am in receipt of the Atlanta Citizen Review Board's letter pertaining to the complaint
—_—__ ]which recommends that the allegation of false arrest be exonerated
and not sustained forthe allegation of harassment.

The Atlanta Police Department forwarded a response letter indicating the Office of
Professional Standards (OPS) had not concluded its investigat the allegation
surrounding an incident involving Ms. MNNNNMand had to reject your recommendation
atthe time, The investigation has since concluded and it was determined from evidence

te the allegation of 4.1.1 Appropriate Action against Officer Headspeth. This
ion also revealed that there was no evidence that Officer Headspeth harassed
Ms MIIIIBin anyway during this encounter.

Having assessed the Atlanta Citizens Review Board and the Department's investigative
findings regarding this matter, I accept the findings of the Atlanta Citizens Review
Board.

Major B.K. Martin, Commander of the Office of Professional Standards, can be
contacted at (404) $46-5945, if you have any concems regarding this complaint.

Sincerely,

——

George, Turner
Chief of Police
GNTiw

July 8, 2015 
 
 
 
 
Chief George Turner 
City of Atlanta Police Department 
226 Peachtree Street, S.W. 
Atlanta, Georgia 30303 
 
 
RE:  Complaint of 
, ACRB File 
 #14-018 & 
, ACRB File #14-032 
 
 
Dear Chief Turner: 
 
Please be advised that the Atlanta Citizen Review Board (ACRB) has concluded its 
investigation and adjudication of the complaint filed by Ms. 
 & 
 
alleging that on February 7, 2014, Atlanta Police Officer Denis Joseph (Unique ID #5031) 
committed the following acts of misconduct: (1) falsely arrested Ms. 
, (2) slammed Ms. 
 head into a brick wall, (3) pointed his firearm at Mr. 
 and (4) engaged in 
abusive language at them.  Mr. 
 further alleged that the handcuffs were applied 
extremely tight. 
 
The Board determined the following: 
 
• 
The false arrest allegation assigned a finding of Sustained and recommend 
that Officer Joseph received a five (5) day suspension and psychological 
counseling.   
• 
The excessive force allegation as it relates only to Ms. 
 allegation that 
Officer Joseph slammed her head into a wall be assigned a finding of 
Sustained and recommend that he received a five (5) day suspension and 
psychological counseling.  However, as it relates to the other excessive force 
allegations raised (the tight handcuffs and the pointing of the firearm) the 
Board assigned a finding of Not Sustained.   
• 
The abusive language allegation assigned a finding of Not Sustained.  
 
The Board further recommends that APD does the following: 
 
1. Any incident that results in the arrest of a citizen, APD should always ensure 
that the dash cam footage be downloaded and saved; 
2. Look into the issue of what took place at the location (999 Dill Avenue) prior 
to the issuance and execution of the search warrant.  Specifically, the 
allegations that officers went into Mr. 
 vehicle and appeared to have 
taken something out of it (an allegation that was caught on tape);   
3. The incident report indicates that a small plastic bag containing one (1) gram 
of marijuana was recovered from the passenger side door handle of Mr. 
 vehicle.  However, this item is not listed in the property report and 
APD’s Property Unit has no record of it.  APD needs to investigate this matter 
further to determine what happened to it or if it existed at all;  
 
 
Chief George Turner 
RE:  Complaint of 
, ACRB File #14-018 & 
, ACRB File #14-032 
July 8, 2015 
Page 2 
 
 
4. The Use of Force Report was not prepared until eight (8) months after the 
incident and only after ACRB’s inquiry of its existence which is in violation 
of APD’s policies.  Therefore, it is recommended that APD look further into 
this issue and takes appropriate action that is in accordance with APD’s 
disciplinary matrix; and  
 
5. It is further recommended, to lessen response-errors, such as responding to the 
wrong location that Sergeant Joseph be counseled on the importance of 
paying attention to details when given an assignment. 
 
The file is available for review upon request.  The ordinance requires that the Chief 
respond in writing regarding which recommendations are accepted, rejected, or will be 
implemented with modifications within thirty (30) days of the submission of a 
recommendation for action by the Board to the Chief (see Sec. 2-2211(O) of the Ordinance 07-
0-0141). 
 
Sincerely, 
 
William Harrison 
Board Chair 
 
cc: Mayor Kasim Reed 
Council President Ceasar Mitchell  
Atlanta City Council Members 
ACRB Members  
Executive Director Lee Reid

['', '', "CITY OF ATLANTA

Kasim Roo 25 Peaches Suet SW ‘Nana Pote Deparment
Mayer ‘Ata, cesta 909 ‘Geerge Tuer
‘aon S600 Chalet Posce

December 16, 2016

‘Ms. Sherry Williams
Allanta Citizen Review Board
City Hall Tower, Suite 9100,
55 Trinity Avenue, SW
‘Atlanta, Georgia 30303

RE: 14-018 Complain
Dear Ms. Williams:

‘Lam in receipt ofthe Atlanta Citizen Review Board's leter pertaining tothe complaint of NL
recommending that the allegations of false arrest and excessive force be sustained
‘against Officer Denis Joseph,

‘The Office of Professional Standards has concluded its investigation and it has determined, from
evidence, to exonerate Officer Denis Joseph forthe Atlanta Police Department work rule 4.1.1
‘Appropriate Action Required and not sustain Officer Joseph for the Atlania Police Department
‘work rule 42.50 Unnecessary Force,

‘The evidence shows that Officer Denis Joseph was dispatched on a leitimate cal for service,
and while doing so he mistakenly went to the wrong address, which appeared tobe done in good
faith, Officer Joseph did observe what appeared to be aviation ofthe law; the burning smell
of marjuana coming from a vehicle parked in the driveway. Afterwards, he attempted 10
investigate the possible illegal drug activity. In the investigation review, there appears tobe no
evidence that would suggest Officer Josep falsely arrested Ms, MII during this incident.
‘There was also no evidence that Officer Joseph used excessive force when he took Ms.
into custody. The video supplied by the complainants does not show the actual hands-on potion
of the incident. Differing of opinions on the level of force used by Officer Joseph exists, and the
medical records of Ms do nt suppor her level of injury she claims to have sustained.

There was also no evidence that Officer Joseph used any profane language towards Ms
durin ths incident. WatchGuard video is regularly saved in any situation where it is deemed
necessary and pertinent; as noted inthe investigation. Ms MN believes that there shouldbe
video from Officer Joseph's patrol vehicle documenting the incident, however, the incident was
nota “triggered event” in the WatchGuard system. In any event, Officer Joseph's vehicle was
parked facing down the street andthe incident took place perpendicular tothe car's positioning
(Cutside the camera's view). Officer Michael Soprano was sustained for the Atlanta Police
Department work rule violation of 42.33 Conformance to Directives. Ms. NNN made an
allegation that money was taken from her vehicle atthe time of her arrest. In review of the

", "= teighbors phone video, you can see several officers standing around the open trunk of the
vehicle while it was being searched but all the officers on the scene deny taking any money. The
cell phone video did show Officer Soprano entering both passenger and driver side of the
complainant's vehicle prior to the issuance ofa search warrant and he therefore received an oral
admonishment. It should be noted that 3.2 ounces of marijuana was tured into property control
by Officer Joseph; this total amount included marijuana found in the house pursuant to the
search warrant as well as 2 small amount found inthe car when an APD K9 dog alerted on it
‘This investigation did reveal that Sgt. Andrew Cerul failed to prepare a use of force report
‘required by policy atthe time of the incident. Sgt. Cerul was sustained for his violation ofthe
policy and isued an oral admonishment.

Having assessed the Atlanta Citizens Review Board and the Department's investigative findings
regarding this matter, I reject the findings ofthe Atanta Citizens Review Board,

“Major J. Durant, Commander ofthe Office of Professional Standards, can be contacted at (404)
‘546-5945, if you have any concerns regarding this complaint.

Sincerely,

Ax p-——

Tumer
ChieFof Police

GNTiw
"]

Dear Ms. Williams:
1am in receipt of the Atlanta Citizen Review Board's letter pertaining to the complaint

of Mr. EIEN, recommending that the allegation of abusive language and
harassment be not sustained against Officer Jovan Edwards

‘The Atlanta Police Department forwarded a response letter indicating the Office of
Professional Standards (OPS) had not concluded its investigation into the allegation
surrounding an incident regarding Mr AIL and had to reject your recommendation
at the time. The investigation has since concluded and it has been determined from
evidence to not sustain Officer Edwards for the Atlanta Police Department work rule
4.1.1 Appropriate Action Required and 4.2.2 Courtesy

Having assessed the Atlanta Citizens Review Board and the Department's investigative
findings regarding this matter, 1 accept the findings of the Atlanta Citizens Review
Board.

Major J. Durant, Commander of the Office of Professional Standards, can be contacted
at (404) 546-5945, if you have any further concerns regarding this complaint.

Sincerely,

Zo -=—-—_

Tumer
Chief of Police
GNT jw

, ACRB

Dear Chief Turner: 
 
Please be advised that the Atlanta Citizen Review Board (ACRB) has 
concluded its investigation and adjudication of the complaint filed by Mr. 
 
 alleging that on September 30, 2014, several unidentified Atlanta Police 
officers falsely imprisoned him.  
 
The Board determined that the false imprisonment allegation be assigned a finding 
of Unfounded.   
 
The file is available for review upon request.  The ordinance requires that the 
Chief respond in writing regarding which recommendations are accepted, rejected, or will 
be implemented with modifications within thirty (30) days of the submission of a 
recommendation for action by the Board to the Chief (see Sec. 2-2211(O) of the 
Ordinance 07-0-0141).

ACRB File #14-115 
 
Dear Chief Turner: 
 
Please be advised that the Atlanta Citizen Review Board (ACRB) has 
concluded its investigation and adjudication of the complaint filed by Mr. 
 
alleging that on September 21, 2013, Atlanta Police Officers Loubens Lundi (Unique ID 
#4945) & Leonard Smith (Unique ID #4087) engaged in excessive force during his arrest.  
 
The Board determined that the excessive force allegation against both officers be 
assigned a finding of Not Sustained.   
 
However, the Board noted that there appears to be an inconsistency in Officer 
Smith’s statement that should be addressed by APD as it relates to him stating that he did 
not have any physical contact with Mr. 
 which is refuted by both Officer Lundi and 
Mr. 
. 
 
The file is available for review upon request.  The ordinance requires that the 
Chief respond in writing regarding which recommendations are accepted, rejected, or will 
be implemented with modifications within thirty (30) days of the submission of a 
recommendation for action by the Board to the Chief (see Sec. 2-2211(O) of the 
Ordinance 07-0-0141).

June 1, 2015 
 
 
 
Chief George Turner 
City of Atlanta Police Department 
226 Peachtree Street, S.W. 
Atlanta, Georgia 30303 
 
 
RE: Complaint of 
, ACRB  
File #14-118 
 
Dear Chief Turner: 
 
Please be advised that the Atlanta Citizen Review Board (ACRB) has 
concluded its investigation and adjudication of the complaint filed by Mr. 
 
that on November 3, 2014, Atlanta Police Officer Maximillian Brewer (Unique ID #4490) 
falsely arrested and falsely imprisoned him, and issued him a citation for improper horn 
use during a traffic stop.  
 
The Board determined that both allegations against Officer Brewer be assigned a 
finding of Not Sustained.   
 
The Board noted that Mr. 
 also alleged that during the alleged incident 
Officer Brewer made the statement, “This is not Burger King, this is my way.”  This 
matter was not investigated because the allegation is outside ACRB’s jurisdiction. 
Therefore, the Board recommends that APD investigate this matter further to determine if 
any APD policy violations occurred. 
 
The file is available for review upon request.  The ordinance requires that the 
Chief respond in writing regarding which recommendations are accepted, rejected, or will 
be implemented with modifications within thirty (30) days of the submission of a 
recommendation for action by the Board to the Chief (see Sec. 2-2211(O) of the 
Ordinance 07-0-0141). 
 
Sincerely, 
 
William Harrison 
Board Chair

['', "CITY OF ATLANTA

Kasi Reed 226 Peace Svea Sw ara Posen
‘Mayer ‘Ara, Georgia 30303, ‘George Turner
{aos sxeeb0o Choose
February 26, 2016

Mr. William Harrison
‘Atlanta Citizen Review Board
City Hall Tower, Suite 9100
155 Trinity Avenue, SW
Atlanta, Georgia 30303

RE: 14-118 Comphint 7
Dear Mr. Harrison:

11am in receipt ofthe Atlanta Citizen Review Board’s letter pertaining to the complaint
of MEEEEEEENE which recommends thatthe allegation of false imprisonment be not
sustained against Officer Maximillian Brewer.

The Atlanta Police Department forwarded a response liter indicating the Office of
Professional Standards (OPS) had not concluded its investigation into the allegation
regarding Mr. NNN and had to reject your recommendation at the time. The
investigation has since concluded and it was determined from evidence to not sustain the
allegation of 4.1.1 Appropriate Action against Officer Brewer.

Having assessed the Atlanta Citizens Review Board and the Department's investigative
findings regarding this matter, I accept the findings of the Atlanta Citizens Review
Board.

Major B.K. Martin, Commander of the Office of Professional Standards, can be
contacted at (404) 546-5945, if you have any concerns regarding this complaint.

Sincerely,

a

George N. Tumer
Chief of Police
GNTiw
"]

April 28, 2015 
 
 
 
 
Chief George Turner 
City of Atlanta Police Department 
226 Peachtree Street, S.W. 
Atlanta, Georgia 30303 
 
 
RE: Complaint of 
, 
 ACRB File #14-090 
 
 
Please be advised that the Atlanta Citizen Review Board (ACRB) has concluded its 
investigation and adjudication of the complaint filed by Mr. 
 alleging that on 
September 3, 2014, Atlanta Police Sergeant Robert Daniels (Unique ID #0728) and Officer 
Brian Carswell (Unique ID #4592) falsely arrested him.  
 
The Board determined that false arrest allegations against both of the 
aforementioned officers be assigned a finding of Sustained and recommend that the 
following penalties be imposed: 
 
• 
Sergeant Robert Daniels—One (1) day suspension and training on the 
proper procedures and protocols on conducting searches in the field.  
• 
Officer Brian Carswell—Written reprimand and training on the proper 
procedures and protocols on conducting searches in the field. 
 
The file is available for review upon request.  The ordinance requires that the Chief 
respond in writing regarding which recommendations are accepted, rejected, or will be 
implemented with modifications within thirty (30) days of the submission of a 
recommendation for action by the Board to the Chief (see Sec. 2-2211(O) of the Ordinance 
07-0-0141). 
 
Sincerely, 
 
William Harrison 
Board Chair

RE: 14-090 Complaint f

Dear Mr. Harrison:

1 am in receipt of the Atlanta Citizen Review Board's letter, dated April 28, 2015,
recommending that the allegation of false arrest be sustained against Officer Brian
Carswell and Sergeant Robert Daniels.

At this time, the Office of Professional Standards has not concluded its investigation into
the allegations surrounding the false arrest of Mr. Bryant. Therefore, in an effort to be in
compliance with the City Ordinance (Sec. 2-2211 (0)], | am obligated at this time to
reject your recommendation as iti imperative thatthe Atlanta Police Department afford
our employees their due process. Once the Office of Profesional Standards has
completed is investigation, I wll reconsider the recommendation of the ACRB.

Major BK. Martin, Commander of the Office of Professional Standards, can be
contacted at (404) 546-5945, if you have any further concems regarding this complaint.

Sincerely,

Georg€N, Turner
Chief of Potice

Chief George Turner 
City of Atlanta Police Department 
226 Peachtree Street, S.W. 
Atlanta, Georgia 30303 
 
 
RE: Complaint of 
, ACRB  
File #14-105 
 
Dear Chief Turner: 
 
Please be advised that the Atlanta Citizen Review Board (ACRB) has concluded its 
investigation and adjudication of the complaint filed by Mr. 
 alleging that 
on August 27, 2014, Atlanta Police Officer Mauricio Castro (Unique ID #2853) falsely 
imprisoned him when he illegally detained him during a traffic stop.  
 
The Board determined that false imprisonment allegation against Officer Castro be 
assigned a finding of Sustained and recommend that the following penalties be imposed: 
 
 
Ten (10) day suspension; and 
 
due to Officer Castro’s extensive disciplinary history, it is further 
recommended that he receive psychological counseling.  
 
The Board also expressed concerned that during the traffic stop, Officer Castro’s 
wireless microphone was not activated in accordance with APD policy.  Thus, it is 
recommended that APD look further into this issue and takes appropriate action that is in 
accordance with APD’s disciplinary matrix. 
 
The file is available for review upon request.  The ordinance requires that the Chief 
respond in writing regarding which recommendations are accepted, rejected, or will be 
implemented with modifications within thirty (30) days of the submission of a 
recommendation for action by the Board to the Chief (see Sec. 2-2211(O) of the Ordinance 
07-0-0141). 
 
Sincerely, 
 
William Harrison 
Board Chair

‘The Office of Professional Standards has concluded its investigation and it has
determined, from evidence, not sustain Officer Mauricio Castro for the Atlanta Police
Department work rule 4.1.1 Appropriate Action Required.

In command review of the file by Deputy Chief Spillane, Officer Castro stated he
abserved Mr MINN vehicle driving around inthe Pitsburgh Community for some
time and he had probable caus to stop Mr. MN for cruising. Officer Cato was
able to provide documentation showing the City Ordinance Sec. 150-296- Cruising on
Public Strets and Amendment 14-0-1068 approved in February 26, 2014; which
prokibits cruising in the Pitsburgh Community. Officer Casro chose not to issue a
Citation to Mr INNIVor the cruising violation because the signage for "No Cruising
Zone” had not been posted by the City at the time of the violation. These signs are now
posted throughout the Pittsburgh Community. It was found that based on the City,
Ordinance Sec. 150-296 and Amendment 14-0-1068, Officer Castro had probable cause
to conduct a traffic stop on Mr. (ENN It was also determined that there was no
audio withthe WatchGuard video due to microphone and audi pack malfunction. This
‘was also confirmed by a watch supervisor Sgt. Henninger and Electronic Maintenance
Supervisor Horace Reid

', "Having assessed the Atlanta Citizens Review Board and the Department's investigative
findings regarding this matter, I reject the findings ofthe Atlanta Citizens Review Board.

‘Major J. Durant, Commander of the Office of Professional Standards, can be contacted
at (404) 546-5945, if you have any concems regarding this complaint.

incerely,

226 Peachtree Street, S.W. 
Atlanta, Georgia 30303 
 
 
RE: Complaint of 
,  
ACRB Case File #14-114 
 
 
Dear Chief Turner: 
 
Please be advised that the Atlanta Citizen Review Board (ACRB) has 
concluded its investigation and adjudication of the complaint filed by Mr. 
 
 alleging that on October 2, 2014, Atlanta Police Sergeant Thomas Apple 
(Unique ID #3757) engaged in unnecessary and excessive force when he choked him 
while at the Zone 3 Precinct.  
 
The Board determined that excessive force allegation against Sergeant Apple 
be assigned a finding of Sustained and recommends that the following penalties be 
imposed: 
 
 Seven (7) day suspension;  
 Training on the APD’s approved restraint techniques.  
 
The Board further recommends that APD looks into the following: 
 
 The inconsistency in Officer Ryan Jones’ ACRB statement 
indicating that Mr. 
 kicked him which resulted in 
him falling to the ground.  None of the other officers that 
were interviewed, including Sergeant Apple, reported that 
this occurred.  
 Furthermore, there appears to be some conflicting accounts as 
to how the search of Mr. 
 was conducted.  It is 
recommended that APD look further into this issue to 
determine whether any constitutional and/or policy violations 
occurred. 
 
Continue on Page 2 
 
 
 
 
Chief George Turner 
RE: Kenny 
, ACRB Case File #14-114 
April 28, 2015 
Page 2 
 
 
 
 
The file is available for review upon request.  The ordinance requires that the 
Chief respond in writing regarding which recommendations are accepted, rejected, or will 
be implemented with modifications within thirty (30) days of the submission of a 
recommendation for action by the Board to the Chief (see Sec. 2-2211(O) of the 
Ordinance 07-0-0141). 
 
 
Sincerely, 
 
William Harrison 
Board Chair

Dear Chief Turner: 
 
Please be advised that the Atlanta Citizen Review Board (ACRB) has 
concluded its investigation and adjudication of the complaint filed by Ms. 
 
alleging that on September 27, 2013, Atlanta Police Officer Willie Arnold (Unique ID 
#3697) harassed her while at the Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport.  
 
The Board determined that harassment allegation against Officer Arnold be 
assigned a finding of Not Sustained.   
 
The file is available for review upon request.  The ordinance requires that the 
Chief respond in writing regarding which recommendations are accepted, rejected, or will 
be implemented with modifications within thirty (30) days of the submission of a 
recommendation for action by the Board to the Chief.  (See Sec. 2-2211(O) of the 
Ordinance 07-0-0141).

April 1, 2015 
 
 
 
Chief George Turner 
City of Atlanta Police Department 
226 Peachtree Street, S.W. 
Atlanta, Georgia 30303 
 
 
RE: Complaint of 
, ACRB File #14- 
        080 
 
Dear Chief Turner: 
 
Please be advised that the Atlanta Citizen Review Board (ACRB) has 
concluded its investigation and adjudication of the complaint filed by Mr. 
 
alleging that on September 14, 2014, Atlanta Police Officers Michael Soprano (Unique ID 
#5760) and Matthew Johns (Unique ID #5242) engaged in unnecessary and excessive 
force when they pepper-sprayed him and repeatedly struck him in the face, head and 
throughout his body without provocation.  
 
The Board determined that excessive force allegations against Officers Soprano 
and Johns be assigned a finding of Sustained and recommend that they both received a 5 
day suspension without pay and training on the use of force. 
 
The file is available for review upon request.  The ordinance requires that the 
Chief respond in writing regarding which recommendations are accepted, rejected, or will 
be implemented with modifications within thirty (30) days of the submission of a 
recommendation for action by the Board to the Chief.  (See Sec. 2-2211(O) of the 
Ordinance 07-0-0141). 
Sincerely, 
 
William Harrison 
Board Chair

ayer

RE: 14-80 Complaint of
Dear Mr, Hartson:

Lam in receipt of the Atlanta Citizen Review Board's letter, regarding the complaint of Mr.
WERE ecornmending that the allegation of excessive force be sustained against Officers
“Matthew Johns and Michael Soprano,

‘The Atlanta Police Department forwarded a response letter indicating the Office of Professional
Standards (OPS) had not conchided its investigation into the allegation surrounding an incident
involving Mr. ANN and had to reject your recommendation atthe time. The investigation has
since been concluded and it was determined from evidence to not sustain the allegation of 4.250
Unnecessary Force against Officers Johns and Soprano.

Mr. MI did not cooperate with request to provide a formal statement on his account of the
‘events, nor did his witnesses. There were no third party witnesses to provide an unbiased
account of what took place.

Having assessed the Atlanta Citizens Review Board and the Department's investigative findings
regarding this matter, | eject the findings ofthe Atlanta Citizens Review Board

Major B.K. Martin, Commander of the Office of Professional Standards, can be contacted at
(404) 546-5945, if you have any concems regarding this complaint,

Sincerely,

Chief of Police
GNThw

Dear Ms. Williams:

1am in receipt of the Atlanta Citizen Review Board’s leter pertaining to the complaint
OfMENENENENNNININIEL recommending that the allegation of harassment be unfounded
against Officer Adriane Warner.

‘The Atlanta Police Department forwarded a response letter indicating the Office of
Professional Standards (OPS) had not concluded its investigation into the allegation
surrounding an incident regarding Mr. Washington, and had to reject your
recommendation at the time. The investigation has since concluded and it has been
determined from evidence to unfound the allegation of 4.1.1 Appropriate Action
Require. It is also recommended thatthe file reflect another “unknown office” due to
lack of evidence tothe officer's identity

Having assessed the Atlanta Citizens Review Board and the Department's investigative
findings regarding this matter, I accept the findings of the Atlanta Citizens Review
Board,

‘Major J. Durant, Commander of the Office of Professional Standards, can be contacted
at (404) 546-5945, if you have any further concems regarding this complaint.

Sincerely,

Chief of Police
ONTiw

Dear Chief Turner: 
 
Please be advised that the Atlanta Citizen Review Board (ACRB) has 
concluded its investigation and adjudication of the complaint filed by Mr. 
 
 alleging that on July 28, 2014 and other unspecified occasions, Atlanta Police 
Officer Jamahl Stokes (Unique ID #6044) harassed him. 
 
The Board determined that the harassment allegation against Officer Stokes be 
assigned a finding of Unfounded. 
 
The file is available for review upon request.  The ordinance requires that the 
Chief respond in writing regarding which recommendations are accepted, rejected, or will 
be implemented with modifications within thirty (30) days of the submission of a 
recommendation for action by the Board to the Chief (see Sec. 2-2211(O) of the 
Ordinance 07-0-0141). 
 
Sincerely, 
Board Chair

Dear Chief Turner: 
 
Please be advised that the Atlanta Citizen Review Board (ACRB) has 
concluded its investigation and adjudication of the complaint filed by Mr. 
 
 alleging that on September 25, 2014, Atlanta Police Officer Brian Johnston 
(Unique ID #5757) falsely imprisoned him when he illegally stopped and detained him. 
 
The Board determined that the false imprisonment allegation against Officer 
Johnston be assigned a finding of Not Sustained. 
 
The file is available for review upon request.  The ordinance requires that the 
Chief respond in writing regarding which recommendations are accepted, rejected, or will 
be implemented with modifications within thirty (30) days of the submission of a 
recommendation for action by the Board to the Chief (see Sec. 2-2211(O) of the 
Ordinance 07-0-0141). 
 
Sincerely, 
 
Board Chair

{am in receipt of the Atlanta Citizen Review Board's letter, dated March 5, 2015,
recommending that the allegation of false imprisonment be not sustained against Officer

AL this time, the Office of Professional Standards has not concluded its investigation into
the allegations surrounding the false imprisonment of Mr. MINIMNE Therefore, in an
‘effort to be in compliance with the City Ordinance (Sec. 2-2211 (0)}, I am obligated to
reject your recommendation at this time as it is imperative that the Atlanta Police
Department afford our employees their due process. Once the Office of Professional
Standards has completed its investigation, I will reconsider the recommendation of the
CRB
